intro: Randia ticaensis, commonly known as the Ticaense Randia, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly found in parts of Guatemala and El Salvador. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are typically yellow or orange when mature. Randia ticaensis is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories and along stream banks.
